channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [GROOVY-9918] NPE in static compiler when calling pathological method signature
item.description:
I'm attempting to call this Java method:

GraphTraversal<S, E> hasId(final Object id, final Object... otherIds)

which has a particularly annoying signature but implements the expected behavior by explicitly checking whether id instanceof Object[] and Doing The Right Thing. However, I'm using lists, and the static compiler gets terribly confused by this:

List<String> ids = ['a', 'b']
inV().hasId(ids as Object[])

In static mode only, this causes an NPE in the compiler (stack trace below). It appears that the compiler can't figure out how to match the method in the presence of the varargs plus a call-site Object[] parameter. This formulation with an explicit cast to Object works:

inV().hasId((Object) (ids as Object[]))

[
item.summary: NPE in static compiler when calling pathological method signature

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This bit in StaticInvocationWriter is trying to compare the arguments and parameters and gets confused by the last argument type being equal to the last parameter type:

    protected void loadArguments(final List<Expression> argumentList, final Parameter[] para) {
        if (para.length == 0) return;
        ClassNode lastParaType = para[para.length - 1].getOriginType();
        AsmClassGenerator acg = controller.getAcg();
        TypeChooser typeChooser = controller.getTypeChooser();
        OperandStack operandStack = controller.getOperandStack();
        int argumentListSize = argumentList.size();
        ClassNode lastArgType = argumentListSize > 0 ?
                typeChooser.resolveType(argumentList.get(argumentListSize -1), controller.getClassNode()) : null;
        if (lastParaType.isArray()
                && ((argumentListSize > para.length)
                || ((argumentListSize == (para.length - 1)) && !lastParaType.equals(lastArgType))
                || ((argumentListSize == para.length && lastArgType!=null && !lastArgType.isArray())
                    && (StaticTypeCheckingSupport.implementsInterfaceOrIsSubclassOf(lastArgType,lastParaType.getComponentType())))
                        || ClassHelper.GSTRING_TYPE.equals(lastArgType) && ClassHelper.STRING_TYPE.equals(lastParaType.getComponentType()))

Minimal recreation:

def m(one, ... zeroOrMore) { }
@groovy.transform.CompileStatic
void test() {
  Object[] ids = ['a', 'b']
  m(ids)
}
Thanks for figuring out the repro; I couldn't reliably determine what was necessary to trigger it in a short form.
